location_pages.bottleneck: Google Maps iframe was loading immediately (even with lazy loading), causing TBT and bandwidth usage issues.

home_page.bottleneck: Hero section LCP image (DoctorCard) was using a 1.3MB high-res original source file, causing unnecessary processing overhead and risk of slow load on cache miss.
home_page.optimization: Resized source image to 400x400px (24KB) to match display requirements.

changes.change: Converted to 'use client' and implemented a placeholder state. Iframe only loads when user clicks 'Load Map'.
changes.impact: Eliminated initial iframe network request and JS execution for map. Significantly improves TBT and LCP (if map was in viewport) for all Location pages.
Reduced LCP source file size by ~98%. Eliminated heavy optimization overhead. Fixed rotation issue by baking in orientation and stripping metadata. Used new filename to ensure cache busting.

verification.manual_check:
1. Navigate to any location page (e.g., /neurosurgeon-banjara-hills). Verify map placeholder is visible. Click 'Load Map' and verify iframe loads correctly.
2. Inspect the doctor image in the hero section on Home. Verify it loads instantly, is the correct resolution, and is NOT rotated (upright orientation). Ensure the filename ends in -v2.jpg.
